page.title: 12DISUSED QUARRY
page.content:
Carn Grey, a disused quarry, is 200m above sea level. From the tor-like top there are magnificent panoramic views of mid-Cornwall. It was used as a general dumping ground until a few years ago when it was transformed into a nature reserve by a group of school children. It has a lake stocked with trout and surrounded by willow trees. The steep sides of the quarry are a favourite haunt of snakes, such as the adder, and the surrounding moor is well-populated with rabbits and other small mammals.
Despite its natural beauty, the area is under new threats from motorcycle scramblers who cut up the quarry floor with their tyre tracks. Fresh attempts are being made to restore the area to the quiet splendour achieved by the schoolchildren.
